بسم اللّه الرّحمن الرّحيم
أطال اللّه بقاكما وأدام عزّكما وكرامتكما وأتم أنعمه نعمته عليكم وزاد في إحسانه
إليكم في الدّنيا والآخرة برحمة أعلمكم أنّي لم أقرأ لكم كتاب من أيّام فغمّــني ــم ذلك
فأسل اللّه أن يجمع بيننا وبينكم في عافية إنّه على ذلك قدير وبعد أكرمكم اللّه إنّما أبطــلت أبطأت
كتابي عنكم من كثــرة الشّغل فــأسل اللّه الرّجوع العود في عافية فأحب أن تكتبي إلي بخبرك
وخبر راصة أبقاه اللّه وخبر أمّك وأخبرو وأخيك خبر وخبر أمين أمّي وأخبرو وأخي خبر وخبر عبّاس أبقاه
اللّه وقد اشتريت لكم منديل واحد ولم أصب إلّا واحد واكتبي إلي بخبرك وحالك
فإنّي أسر بذلك إن شا اللّه وإنّما أغيب عنكم مقدار شهر وهو آخر طوبة فــأسل اللّه
أن يجمع بيننا وبينكم في عافية إن شا اللّه حضر خصّ ثوبكم نفسك بالسّلام وعلى راصة أبقاه
اللّه السّلام وعلى أمّك وأختك وعبّاس السّلام كثيرا واكتبي إلي بخبر صاحب البيت اليهوديّ
المصري الصّيرف إلى منزله يدفع إلى أبوا خير من بقام الملّاح
يدفع إلى الحسن بلّغ رحمك اللّه

In the name of God the merciful and compassionate. In the name of God, the merciful and compassionate.
May God prolong your life, preserve your strength and nobility, give a full measure of his bounty and increase his goodness
to you in this world and the next, with mercy! (I am writing to) let you know that I have not read a letter of yours for days and... worried me, to you in this world and the next, with mercy. (I am writing to) let you know that I have not read a letter of yours for days and [...] worried me,
and I pray to God that he will bring us together in good health. He has the power to do that. As for what follows - may God show you kindness - I ceased and I pray to God that he will bring us together in good health. He has the power to do that. As for what follows - may God show you kindness! - I ceased
writing to you due to my many preoccupations. I pray to God that (I shall) return in good health. I should like you to write to me (and tell me) your news,
the news of Rāṣe - may God preserve him - and the news of your mother. Give ma also news of ʾAmīn and ʿAbbās - may God preserve him. the news of Raseh - may God preserve him! - and the news of your mother. Give ma also news of Amin and ʿAbbas - may God preserve him!
I have bought a kerchief for you. I acquired only one. Write to me (to tell me) your news and how you are, I have bought for you one kerchief. I acquired only one. Write to me (to tell me) your news and how you are
for I shall be given pleasure by that, God willing. I shall only be away from you for a month, that is (to) the end of Tubah. [I pray to God] for I shall be given pleasure by that, God willing. I shall only be away from you for a month, that is (to) the end of Ṭūba. [I pray to God]
... Laß Dich ganz speziell grüßen!... that he will bring us together in health. God willing, your garment will have arrived safely. Give my best wishes to Rāṣe - may God preserve him - that He will bring us together in health. God willing, your garment will have arrived safely. Give my best wishes to Raseh - may God preserve him! -
and my very best wishes to your mother, your sister and ʿAbbas. Write to me (and tell me) the news of the Jewish landlord. and my very best wishes to your mother, your sister and ʿAbbās. Write to me (and tell me) the news of the Jewish landlord.
